trans-unit.source: Represents the root class for the Xml schema object model hierarchy and serves as a base class for classes such as the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject"></xref> class.
This constructor is called by derived class constructors to initialize state in this type.
Gets or sets the line number in the file to which the `schema` element refers.
`LineNumber` is used to store the line number when a schema is read from a file.
This is reported through <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaException> for error handling.
The line number.
Gets or sets the line position in the file to which the `schema` element refers.
This is used to store the line position when a schema is read from a file.
This is reported through <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaException> for error handling.
The line position.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializerNamespaces"></xref> to use with this schema object.
This gives the Schema Object Model (SOM) the ability to add xmlns declarations.
This is useful when you want to declare a prefix to qualify declarations from an imported schema or use in the xpath attribute of the xs:selector element.
You can also use the <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject.Namespaces%2A> property to change namespace prefixes in a schema.
For example, you can change the prefix used by a schema for the W3C XML Schema namespace from xs to xsd as illustrated in the following example.
The <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializerNamespaces"></xref> property for the schema object.
Gets or sets the parent of this <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject"></xref>.
The parent <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject"></xref> of this <xref href="System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchemaObject"></xref>.
Gets or sets the source location for the file that loaded the schema.
Provides information for exception handling.
The source location (URI) for the file.
